meanings.definition: Raise (one's shoulders) slightly and momentarily to express doubt, ignorance, or indifference.
meanings.sent1: She was shrugging when asked about the homework, showing she didn't know the answer.
meanings.sent2: He is always shrugging whenever he is unsure about something.
meanings.sent3: The cat was shrugging at the sight of the new toy, unsure if it was a threat.
meanings.sent4: The clouds were shrugging off the rain, as if indifferent to the weather.
meanings.sent5: The student kept shrugging during the test, indicating uncertainty about the questions.
